## Properties

| **Property**        | **Values**      | **Default** |
| ------------------- | --------------- | ----------- |
| Size `Variant`      | `3Xs \| 2Xs`    | `2Xs`       |
| Has label `Boolean` | `true \| false` | `true`      |
| Label `Text`        | `string`        | `15%`       |

## When to use

{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M5 13l4 4L19 7" style={{ stroke: "var(--color-text-positive)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} When progress is determinate, meaning the system can measure and display completion percentage. <br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M5 13l4 4L19 7" style={{ stroke: "var(--color-text-positive)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} When progress moves towards completion in a linear manner, such as file uploads, form completion or loading screens. <br/><br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M6 6L18 18M6 18L18 6" style={{ stroke: "var(--color-text-negative)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} When the progress is indeterminate and you cannot measure completion, use loader instead. <br/>

## Size

Dimensions of the linear progress are tied to the global `scale` tokens. This ensures that the components with similar size settings remain consistent across the interface. `scale` tokens also provides more granular control over dimensional settings.

```css:scale.css showLineNumbers
--scale-width-<size>
--scale-height-<size>
--scale-gap-<size>
--scale-radius-<size>
--scale-text-size-<size>
--scale-text-height-<size>
```
